titleStmt.title: Hans Liebstöckl [Liebstoeckl]
born Vienna, Feb 26, 1872; died Vienna, April 24, 1934

publicationStmt.publisher: Schenker Documents Online in association with the Centre for Computing in the Humanities

sourceDesc.p: No source: created in electronic format.

encodingDesc.p: Encoding according to the CCH TEI Guidelines

div.head: Career Summary
div.p: Liebstöckl studied violin at the Vienna Conservatory, as well as law and philosophy at the Universities of Prague and Vienna. He wrote for the Neues Wiener Tagblatt, the Illustriertes Wiener Extrablatt, and other papers, particularly as theater critic, becoming the chief editor of the Bühne in 1925, later of the Illustriertes Wiener Extrablatt itself.

div.head: Correspondence with Schenker
div.p: One letter from Schenker to Liebstöckl survives as OC 1/A 4-5 (1911: carbon copy) and three items from Liebstöckl to Schenker as OJ 12/38 (undated and 1928). Schenker's scrapbook includes clippings of three of his reviews, all using the word "Urlinie."
